page.title: 07Farming:Hutton-le-Hole Area
page.content: Westfield Farm, on the plateau to the west of the village, is worked by the owners, the Strickland family. It is a mixed farm of 160 acres, mostly under arable rotation, with increasing amounts of winter wheat, winter barley and oil-seed rape.They also have sheep beef cattle and some woodland.The flat Spaunton land is farmed by tenants of Grange Farm. Again it is mixed with corn,roots and beef. Most of the small valley bottom fields around the village are farmed by the Farrow and Ford families.The Farrows have a flock of about 200 black-faced sheep grazing the open common(see G.R.04720489 Manor of Spaunton:Court Leet) both grassland in the village and heather moorland to the north.Various areas of woodland are owned by Mr W.Darley,Lord of Spaunton Manor.
